alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 31 at 7:29PM PST until January 02 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet for the Santa Barbara South Coast, except 8 to 12 feet near Point Conception. Strong and dangerous rip currents are also expected. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast and Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to noon PST Monday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast
